item.title: Shaun Pryor
item.description:
Shaun Pryor has been writing, performing and recording music for as long as he can remember and has recently established himself more solidly as a producer working with various bands and artists around Brisbane and the Gold Coast as well as producing his own works. Shaun strives to work with artists in all aspects of the creative musical process including the composition, arrangement and performance, all of which he believes are vital to achieving a polished recording.

Building Lives is an original composition completed in a minimal environment with minimal instruments and recording equipment. The focus of the recording was to achieve a sense of space within a dry recording.

More tracks are available at http://www29.griffith.edu.au/radioimersd/content/view/224/
item.itunes:author: Shaun Pryor
item.itunes:subtitle: Building Lives is an original composition completed in a minimal environment with minimal instruments and recording equipment. The focus of the recording was to achieve a sense of space within a dry recording.

item.title: Matt Rouse
item.description:
Matt completed a Diploma of Music Industry (Technical Production) at Southbank Institute of Technology before coming to the Queensland conservatorium and will be commencing his final year of the Bachelor of Music Technology degree at Griffith University in 2010. Matt's hope is that the skills and knowledge gained throughout his studies will aid him in his desire to become a respected and successful member of the music industry.

End Of Black Days is the first self-composed, studio recorded track that Matt has produced at the Conservatorium. Stylistically influenced by artists such as Sonic Youth, Radiohead, and The Doors, the song is about one's salvation from loneliness. Music, recording and production by Matt Rouse. Viola by Natasha Wittmaack.
item.itunes:author: Matt Rouse
item.itunes:subtitle: End Of Black Days:End Of Black Days was written, recorded and produced by Matt. Stylistically influenced by artists such as Sonic Youth, Radiohead, and The Doors, the song is about one's salvation from loneliness.
item.itunes:summary: End Of Black Days:End Of Black Days is the first self-composed, studio recorded track that Matt has produced at the Conservatorium. Stylistically influenced by artists such as Sonic Youth, Radiohead, and The Doors, the song is about one's salvation from loneliness. Music, recording and production by Matt Rouse. Viola by Natasha Wittmaack.

item.title: Kyle Damm
item.description:
Kyle Damm, graduating from the Griffith Conservatorium Music Technology Bachelors Degree in 2009, has been surrounded by music since his early childhood. Kyle has 8 years Bass Guitar experience with live Popular, Stage, Jazz and Concert Band experience. This experience is coupled with the skills and attributes gained through recording and producing whilst completing his degree. Kyle has interests and experience in all styles of music specifically Acoustic groups and small Funk/Fusion bands. Along with his passion for music, Kyle is also deeply interested in Forensic Audio applications having completed a study into Audio Signal Enhancement Algorithms for the Forensic Audio field.

More tracks are available at http://www29.griffith.edu.au/radioimersd/content/view/222/
item.itunes:author: Kyle Damm
item.itunes:subtitle: Kyle Damm is graduating from the Griffith Conservatorium Music Technology Bachelors Degree in 2009. This original piece is taken from his portfolio.

item.title: Tim McVinish
item.description:
Tim McVinish is a Producer, Studio Engineer, Live Sound Technician and all round music enthusiast who is located in Brisbane. He likes to think of himself as an extremely flexible & easy going producer/engineer who is constantly striving to bring out the best of himself and those he works with.

Tim didn’t discover his passion for music until his mid teen’s when he started learning the guitar, however once he discovered music it quickly became his life. While finishing his studies Tim has been actively working in the Brisbane Music Industry as a Sound Technician for several production companies including BMA Event Group and Brisbane Marketing as well as various other local music venues and events.

Blessed To Receive was one of seven original songs Mic McCombe, recorded with Tim McVinish. The Mic McCombe band is know for mixing funk flavours with their earthy Blues & Roots core. This track was recorded, engineered & mixed by Tim McVinish & Jordan Wiggins, and produced by Tim McVinish, Jordan Wiggins & Mic McCombe.
item.itunes:author: Tim McVinish
item.itunes:subtitle: Blessed To Receive was one of seven original songs Mic McCombe, recorded with Tim McVinish. The Mic McCombe band is know for mixing funk flavours with their earthy Blues & Roots core.

item.title: Andrew Chen
item.description:
Andrew Chen began the mutech degree in 2008, and since then has landed on several different interests, namely band arranging, sampling found sounds, music 2.0 ideologies, songwriting, beat-making, gigging, press and public relations and artist management. "This mutek program is not only showing me the skills to be a better musician or engineer, but also inspiring me to dive into the real-world of public relations, artist management, audio industries and other full-on music business professions."

This indie R&B piece is "a song about writing a song" and is from Andrew's debut album (released in September 2009). It represents a "DIY bedroom recording" production aesthetic, where Andrew has performed all the voices and instruments and collected all the "found sounds," crafting the mix using Apple's Logic software. Mastering was done by mutek alumni Dominic McGlinn.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Chen
item.itunes:subtitle: This indie R&B piece is "a song about writing a song" and is from Andrew's debut album (released in September 2009). It represents a "DIY bedroom recording" production aesthetic, where Andrew has performed all the voices and instruments.
item.itunes:summary: Andrew Chen began the mutech degree in 2008, and since then has landed on several different interests, namely band arranging, sampling found sounds, music 2.0 ideologies, songwriting, beat-making, gigging, press and public relations and artist management. "This mutek program is not only showing me the skills to be a better musician or engineer, but also inspiring me to dive into the real-world of public relations, artist management, audio industries and other full-on music business professions."

item.title: Quantum Love by Daniel Newstead
item.description:
A collaboration with Manny Molecular and New York based spoken word poet Larissa Shmailo. Larissa recently performed the piece at the New Century Peoples choice music awards in New York.
New Born - written, produced and recorded by Daniel Newstead. This song was part of a 6-track EP (The Spiral) independently released under Omegachild Productions.

Daniel Newstead has been actively involved in music for the past 10 years having completed 8th grade piano, Diploma of music production at Southbank Institute of Technology, and is currently in his final year of a Bachelor or Music Technology at the Queensland Conservatorium. Daniel has recently been recognised by The New Century Peoples Choice Awards in New York for his work with Larissa Shmailo. Releasing his work under the name Omegachild Productions, Daniel records, produces, writes and performs with local and international artists in a multitude of styles. Currently he is writing and producing two albums with Brisbane based hard rock band 'Acid Theory' and Canadian rapper/poet Morgan Macmanus.

For more information about Daniel, visit his website at www.omegachildproductions.com
item.itunes:author: Daniel Newstead
item.itunes:subtitle: A collaboration with Manny Molecular and New York based spoken word poet Larissa Shmailo. Larissa recently performed the piece at the New Century Peoples choice music awards in New York.

item.title: Them Penguins by Daniel Newstead
item.description:
This song is a collaboration between Morgan Macmanus, Blak Lungz (NY) and Dan. The song focuses on global warming issues and supports these themes with a hard edged electronic hip-hop sound. Lyrics and Vocals by Morgan Macmanus and Blak Lungz. Music, recording and production by Daniel Newstead.

Daniel Newstead has been actively involved in music for the past 10 years having completed 8th grade piano, Diploma of music production at Southbank Institute of Technology, and is currently in his final year of a Bachelor or Music Technology at the Queensland Conservatorium. Daniel has recently been recognised by The New Century Peoples Choice Awards in New York for his work with Larissa Shmailo. Releasing his work under the name Omegachild Productions, Daniel records, produces, writes and performs with local and international artists in a multitude of styles. Currently he is writing and producing two albums with Brisbane based hard rock band 'Acid Theory' and Canadian rapper/poet Morgan Macmanus.

For more information about Daniel, visit his website at www.omegachildproductions.com

item.description:
A collaboration with Brisbane singer Bec Del Valle. This is an experimental pop tune influenced by artists such as Bjork. Vocals and Lyrics by Bec Del Valle. Music and production by Daniel Newstead.

Daniel Newstead has been actively involved in music for the past 10 years having completed 8th grade piano, Diploma of music production at Southbank Institute of Technology, and is currently in his final year of a Bachelor or Music Technology at the Queensland Conservatorium. item.title: Remembrance by Jade Pegg
item.description:
Jade Pegg - 2009

Jade Pegg is a Brisbane based third year Music Technology student with a strong focus on production, sound design and field recording.

Jade is well known for her work with electronic music, in particular the genre of Electronic Body Music (EBM) under the artist name 'Acidtrixx'. This project is heavily influenced by the underground European electronic music scene associated with the cyber-gothic culture. Other works by Jade include audio visual compositions for iOrpheus which was staged at South Bank, Brisbane in 2007.

Jade is currently assisting with music composition and production for 3rd year animation students attending the Queensland College of Art. Jade hopes to expand her production and engineering skills to high profile animations and video game projects.

Rememberance
This track was influenced by the early pioneers of the EBM genre with particular focus on heavy, dirty reverbs with long decays and detuned, strained vocals.
item.itunes:author: Jade Pegg
item.itunes:subtitle: Jade Pegg is a Brisbane based third year Music Technology student with a strong focus on production, sound design and field recording.

item.title: The Rope by Reilly Smethurst
item.description:
Reilly Smethurst is a young composer, sound producer, amateur poet and a member of the prestigious Griffith Honours College. Reilly has worked in theatre as a composer and sound designer for works featured at Brisbane Powerhouse’s international Big Ticket season and the 2008 Metro Arts Creative Development Festival.

In 2009, Reilly has assisted the development of Sonic Babylon, had an original work - Authentic Elevator Music - installed in an elevator at QUT's creative precinct and has been instrumental in the development of the Sounding Out Composers' Collective.

The Rope - an electroacoustic piece featuring poetry recitations and guitar/violin loops. Composed and produced by Reilly Smethurst and performed by Travis Ash, Margi Brown Ash, Adam Cadell and Ryan Potter.

item.itunes:subtitle: The Rope - an electroacoustic piece featuring poetry recitations and guitar/violin loops. Composed and produced by Reilly Smethurst and performed by Travis Ash, Margi Brown Ash, Adam Cadell and Ryan Potter.

In 2009, Reilly has assisted the development of Sonic Babylon, had an original work - Authentic Elevator Music - installed in an elevator at QUT's creative precinct and has been instrumental in the development of the Sounding Out Composers' Collective.
The Rope - an electroacoustic piece featuring poetry recitations and guitar/violin loops. Composed and produced by Reilly Smethurst and performed by Travis Ash, Margi Brown Ash, Adam Cadell and Ryan Potter.

item.title: Little Impossibles by Reilly Smethurst
item.description:
Reilly Smethurst is a young composer, sound producer, amateur poet and a member of the prestigious Griffith Honours College. Reilly has worked in theatre as a composer and sound designer for works featured at Brisbane Powerhouse’s international Big Ticket season and the 2008 Metro Arts Creative Development Festival.

In 2009, Reilly has assisted the development of Sonic Babylon, had an original work - Authentic Elevator Music - installed in an elevator at QUT's creative precinct and has been instrumental in the development of the Sounding Out Composers' Collective.

Little Impossibles part II - an electroacoustic piece featuring poetry recitations, sine tone generators, processed sampler instruments, and an improvised violin solo. Composed and produced by Reilly Smethurst and performed by Travis Ash, Margi Brown Ash, Adam Cadell and Reilly Smethurst.
item.itunes:author: Reilly Smethurst
item.itunes:subtitle: Little Impossibles part II - an electroacoustic piece featuring poetry recitations, sine tone generators, processed sampler instruments, and an improvised violin solo.

item.title: Joints by James Wells-Wilson
item.description: James Wells-Wilson is a first year (2008) student. The music is a cross pollination of psy prog and electro house. Bass line melody is fundamental to the 'Bad Mojo' sound. Distinctly flavoured with blues and modal scales, the aim is to sound as if Django Reinhardt and Bootsy Colins were put in a blender and spat out to create an epic chromatic run.
item.itunes:author: James Wells-Wilson
item.itunes:subtitle: James Wells-Wilson is a first year (2008) student. The music is a cross pollination of psy prog and electro house.

item.title: In Time by Andrew Chen
item.description: Andrew Chen is a first year (2008) student. This track lives for the waves of beautifully destructive random backwards guitars about two thirds in. Lots of light and shade used. Originally a guitar and vocal track about miscommunication (it certainly sounds as if it were recorded in solitude - single voice and guitar, and then a whole heap afterwards). Major seventh chords exclusively, almost.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Chen
item.itunes:subtitle: Andrew Chen is a first year (2008) student. Originally a guitar and vocal track about miscommunication (it certainly sounds as if it were recorded in solitude - single voice and guitar, and then a whole heap afterwards).

item.title: Gregory by Andrew McLellan
item.description: Andrew McLellan is a second year (2008) student. The song "Gregory" is an excerpt from an extended improvised jam titled Fourth of the Forth produced and directed by Andrew McLellan under his collaboration collective title “Cured Pink Radio”. Featured is fellow Conservatorium students Ryan Wyatt and Ryan Potter on guitar with Ritchard Daniell on drums.

item.title: Crossroads by Surya Sumantara
item.description: Surya is a second year (2008) student. Crossroads is the first track recorded for an upcoming EP for local band "The Creamy Justice". The band draws influence from artists such as John Mayer, Marvin Gaye and Eric Clapton.

item.title: Fred & Jill by Tim Roberts
item.description: Tim Roberts is a second year (2008) student. Various audio manipulation techniques were used in the piece composed entirely from a single recording of the word Supercalafragelisticexpialadocious spoken by Lachlan Bell.
item.itunes:author: Tim Roberts
item.itunes:subtitle: Tim Roberts is a second year (2008) student. Various audio manipulation techniques were used in the piece composed entirely from a single recording of the word Supercalafragelisticexpialadocious spoken by Lachlan Bell.

item.title: The Beginning by Tim Roberts
item.description: Tim Roberts is a second year (2008) student. This piece was inspired by text from The Magician's Nephew by C.S. Lewis in which the creation of Narnia is described. It was originally written in 2006 for the Toowoomba State High School Orchestra.

item.title: Offshoot by Tim Roberts
item.description: Tim Roberts is a second year (2008) student. This piece for 5 instruments was composed in 2007 for the Sibelius Student Composer Awards.

item.title: Simple Things by Dave Mooney
item.description: Dave Mooney is a third year (2008) student. This is one of three songs selected to feature Dave's work with Brisbane based independent artist Scott Anderson. Recorded, Produced and Engineered as part of Dave's final year folio, the full length album will be available for purchase in late 2008.

item.title: Work to Date - A vodcast by James Tonkin
item.description: James Tonkin is a third year (2008) student. Semester one of his final year within the Bachelor of Music Technology program has brought together two projects that have challenged his personal and professional preconceptions of album/EP production and sound design. This Vodcast is a preview for both.

item.title: Tortilla
item.description:
Joff Bush - Keyboard /Accordion

After winning the ‘Jiants of Jazz Rhythm Player of the Year Award’ in 2002, Joff went on to study piano and composition at the Queensland Conservatorium. He has since become a prolific instrumentalist in the Brisbane music scene performing will many popular bands. His compositions have featured extensively in film, concerts and in the vibrant club scene.

This piece was recorded and engineered by Naomi Ham and Kirk Harmer, both students in the Bachelor of Music Technology Honors Program.
item.itunes:author: Joph Bush
item.itunes:subtitle: Joph Bush and Dave Rabinovici
item.itunes:summary:
Joff Bush - Keyboard /Accordion
After winning the ‘Jiants of Jazz Rhythm Player of the Year Award’ in 2002, Joff went on to study piano and composition at the Queensland Conservatorium. He has since become a prolific instrumentalist in the Brisbane music scene performing will many popular bands. His compositions have featured extensively in film, concerts and in the vibrant club scene.
This piece was recorded and engineered by Naomi Ham and Kirk Harmer, both students in the Bachelor of Music Technology Honors Program.

item.title: Rumba
item.description:
Youka Snell (violin) and David Woo (guitar)

Both classically trained musicians, Youka and David share a love of Spanish flamenco, jazz and contemporary tango music. Together they have composed, arranged and studied various pieces of Spanish and Latin-flavoured music, and these recordings are a sample of their collaborations. Youka and David are both in their final year of studies, Bachelor of Music, at the Queensland Conservatorium of Music.

This piece was recorded and engineered by Naomi Ham and Kirk Harmer, both students in the Bachelor of Music Technology Honors Program.
item.itunes:author: Youka Snell and Dave Woo
item.itunes:subtitle: Youka Snell and Dave Woo.

item.title: Get Up
item.description:
Phunk Shui is here! And they’re set to have a major impact on the Australian funk fusion scene. Based in Brisbane, their unique style of fusion draws as much from Jazz and Latin influences as it does from Funk and Hip-Hop. One of Phunk Shui’s greatest strengths is that all it’s members bring something exciting and different to the music. Right from the start, the combination of Cleon’s jazz piano with Ben’s funk bass formed the basis of the Phunk Shui ‘sound’. However, due in no small part to the addition of Luke and Gabriel, that ‘sound’ has evolved into something special.

Individually the members of this four piece unit have no shortage of experience having played with acts as diverse as The New York Opera, The National Radio Big Band Orchestra of Bucharest, La Gran Salsa, Gorgonzolla, Phoebus, and Glockenspiel. This is just the beginning for Phunk Shui, who are currently preparing material for they’re debut album. However, if you just can’t wait to hear them, you can catch Phunk Shui at one of their local gigs. Check Phunk Shui.net for details and watch this space!

item.title: Final Drinks
item.description:
About the Band: The band GPMR came together to record a song co-written by Gaye Pegler and Wade Gregory, Final Drinks. As well as having an exquisite voice, vocalist Megan Radford was a clear choice to sing Gaye’s words for a personal reason: Megan’s mother Margaret lost her battle with cancer in late 2005, Gaye in early 2006. With luscious strings by Youka Snell and Rani Jeong, and compassionately supported by Tom Flenady’s bass and Joel Hardy’s flugelhorn, GPMR were honored to be working in such professional and inspiring surroundings. They hope that the sum of all these parts come together to allow Gaye’s final words to shine, and to pay tribute to the memories of Gaye Pegler and Margaret Radford.

About the Song: Final Drinks is a song inspired by the words of Gaye Pegler. Diagnosed with CLL (chronic lymphocytic leukaemia) in 2000, Gaye wrote a reflective poem whilst sitting with husband Michael at Mooloolaba beach several years into her illness. She passed these words onto her friend Wade Gregory, and together they composed Final Drinks. Gaye lost her long battle with cancer in early 2006, and felt truly blessed to have had a song in which to express herself.
item.itunes:author: GPMR
item.itunes:subtitle: GPMR
item.itunes:summary:

She passed these words onto her friend Wade Gregory, and together they composed Final Drinks. Gaye lost her long battle with cancer in early 2006, and felt truly blessed to have had a song in which to express herself.

item.title: Booyah
item.description:
Lunch Time Concert by "Safety Dance"

Safety Dance are...

Tony D - Drums
Tony Dean has impressive reputation as one of Brisbane's hottest young drummers. His intense passion for drumming has led him to study at the Queensland Conservatorium where his is currently in his final year. When Tony isn't "ripping it up" with Safety Dance you can find him playing with other various well known Brisbane acts such as The Martinis and Emma Dean.

Joff Bush - Keyboard /Accordion
After winning the ‘Jiants of Jazz Rhythm Player of the Year Award’ in 2002, Joff went on to study piano and composition at the Queensland Conservatorium. He has since become a prolific instrumentalist in the Brisbane music scene performing will many popular bands. His compositions have featured extensively in film, concerts and in the vibrant club scene.

Joe Roberts - Baritone and Tenor Saxophones
Joseph's fiery and relentlessly exciting saxophone playing has made him a popular artist in the Brisbane music scene. Joseph has performed in all manner of venues and ensembles. The Con Artists, West End Composers Collective, The Line and Kafka are just a small selection of the numerous different musical outfits he has performed with.

item.title: Youka Snell - VST Authoring 1
item.description: Assessment exemplar from the course "Virtual Studio Technologies" 2006. In this example, student Youka Snell has worked with the idea of a broadcast style expose of her duo's work. Youka has taken original music recorded at the Con and applied images in support of the audio. Youka is currently studying in the Jazz degree and is taking this Music Technology course as an elective. A steep learning curve.
item.itunes:author: Youka Snell
item.itunes:subtitle: Open your video window to view enhanced podcast. Assessment exemplar from "Virtual Studio Technologies".

item.title: Anna Herzig - VST Authoring 1
item.description: Assessment exemplar from the course "Virtual Studio Technologies" 2006. In this example, international visiting student Anna Herzig has created a personal reflection of some of her experiences in Australia. Anna has composed and recorded music to support her personal images. Anna is a not a Music Technology specialist, taking this course as an elective as part of her classical studies. A steep learning curve and very well done.

item.description: Assessment exemplar from the course "Virtual Studio Technologies" 2006. In this example, student Jon McFarlane has created a brief look behind the scenes of one of his original pieces. Jon has created all original material. A good outcome for a first assignment in this course.

item.title: Kevin Babbage - VST Authoring 1
item.description: Assessment exemplar from the course "Virtual Studio Technologies" 2006. In this example, student Kevin Babbage has worked with the idea of creating an easily portable digital portfolio of his media work. Kevin has used a mix of original and sourced art to support his original music. Kevin is undertaking the course as part of a Bachelor of Multi-Media with a Major in Sound Production.

item.title: Philip Tyrer - VST Authoring 1
item.description: Assessment exemplar from the course "Virtual Studio Technologies" 2006. In this example, student Philip Tyrer has created a story book idea with all original media content. Philip has created theme music, slides, and background music to support the images, story and characters. Excellent outcome for a first assignment in this course.
item.itunes:author: Philip Tyrer
item.itunes:subtitle: Open your video window to view enhanced podcast. Assessment exemplar from "Virtual Studio Technologies".
item.itunes:summary: Assessment exemplar from "Virtual Studio Technologies". In this example, student Philip Tyrer has created a story book idea with all original media content. Philip has created theme music, slides, and background music to support the images, story and characters. Excellent outcome for a first assignment in this course.

item.title: Punchline (Interview)
item.description:
To describe Raven Squad Elite without hearing them first is a difficult task. The closest representation would be an equal blend of the contemporary pop music and hardcore punk genres. The vocals and melodic hooks are soulful and catchy, yet the rhythms often bounce between big beat, break beat, hip-hop and some extremely brutal 2-step (often in half-time) which is more than appropriate for vocal screaming and for audiences to fight dance to.

Yeo and Tim are currently studying a Bachelor of Music Technology at the Queensland Conservatorium. Ritchie studies Bachelor of Music, majoring in jazz performance on the drumset.
item.itunes:author: Raven Squad Elite
item.itunes:subtitle: Ravensquad Elite

item.title: Something (Interview)
item.description:
Courtney Johns came to music technology degree with a background of classical sax and piano, a love for IT and physics and a vague idea as to what music technology actually was. Since then she has developed a passion for sound recording, producing and electroacoustic composition. She is particularly interested in sound design and composing for film and is looking to pursue this in the future.

Born to a family of bankers, Zahiah Jumat defied expectations and found her passion in the financially-unrelated field of music. Deciding that stage fright will be a major obstacle in her initial pursuit of becoming a concert pianist, she left the sunny island of Singapore to the sunny city of Brisbane, embarking on a new journey into the world of Music Technology. Zahiah is currently in her third year of the Bachelor of Music Technology.
item.itunes:author: Johns and Jumat
item.itunes:subtitle: Courtney Johns and Zahiah Jumat
item.itunes:summary:
Courtney Johns came to music technology degree with a background of classical sax and piano, a love for IT and physics and a vague idea as to what music technology actually was. Since then she has developed a passion for sound recording, producing and electroacoustic composition. She is particularly interested in sound design and composing for film and is looking to pursue this in the future.
Born to a family of bankers, Zahiah Jumat defied expectations and found her passion in the financially-unrelated field of music. Deciding that stage fright will be a major obstacle in her initial pursuit of becoming a concert pianist, she left the sunny island of Singapore to the sunny city of Brisbane, embarking on a new journey into the world of Music Technology. Zahiah is currently in her third year of the Bachelor of Music Technology.

item.title: Turn Around - The Interview
item.description:
Turn Around - The Interview

Brenton Fitzgerald is a third-year Music Technology student and a drummer in two original bands.

Brenton is currently undertaking the Music Industry Affiliates Program at Sheldon College, where he recently co-managed sound and staging for the college production of “Grease”.

On finishing his degree, Brenton hopes to further his studies in Music Technology/Audiology and regularly perform with his band.

Gillian Lee is also a third-year Music Technology student. She has played piano for 15 years and is currently playing in an original band.

Gillian is currently undertaking the Music Technology Industry Affiliates Program (MTIAP) at local community television station, Briz31, where she helps produce and manage several television programs.

In the next few years, Gillian hopes to further her studies in Music Technology/Audio Design to develop her career path.

item.title: Psycho - The Interview
item.description:
Psycho - The Interview with Dan and Dom.

Dominic Wyeth is not an amazing musician.
He does not play any instrument extremely well and has not done so since he was born.
He has no profound and deep understanding of the way that music interacts with your world.
He also does not know how the world works and this has in no way impacted on his songs.
Dominic Wyeth does not take his influences from any one person.
He does not think the world is a happy, sad, amazing, boring, or even remotely interesting place.

Dominic Wyeth merely exists and makes music

item.title: Pretty Heart - The interview
item.description:
Pretty Heart

In the 10 month of 2005 there was an imbalance of power in Queensland Conservatorium. Three students stirred in the undergrowth of the music technology department, conspiring to manufacture and release a musical beast that would devour pop music as we know it. The defiance of social structure in such a well-pronounced institution put fear into the hearts of the scholarly. These audacious visionaries have since been dubbed ‘The October Revolution’…

In fear of their lives (and reputation) the members of the revolution have adopted alter egos; Benjamin Vlad (the impaler) – wielding spiked synths, drum machines and banshee vocals. Alex Weasel Bennett – bass guitar, frequencies below 60hz and additional drum programming. Anthony Pink (o) – rock moves and guitar.

The music produced by the October Revolution is an eclectic (Molotov) cocktail consisting of two parts anarchic punk and one part 80’s pop shaken with a bit-crushed video game.
item.itunes:author: October Revolution
item.itunes:subtitle: Pretty Heart by October Revolution. October Revolution is Benjamin Vlad, Anthony Pink and Alex Bennett.
